BR_text.BRsummary: [Bug] Failed to install model-optimizer for 2021.1 on CentOS 7
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h5>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
 
 
 OpenVINO => 2021.1
 Operating System / Platform => Xeon / CentOS 7 docker
 Problem classification: Installation phase
 
 <denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
 
 When upgrading our recipe with OpenVINO 2021.1, encountered that model-optimizer fails to install on CentOS 7.
 <denchmark-code>[root@E3-1585-3 model-optimizer]# pip3 install --target=/home/build/mo_libs -r requirements.txt
 WARNING: Running pip install with root privileges is generally not a good idea. Try `pip3 install --user` instead.
 Ignoring tensorflow: markers 'python_version >= "3.8"' don't match your environment
 Collecting tensorflow<2.0,>=1.15.2 (from -r requirements.txt (line 1))
   Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement tensorflow<2.0,>=1.15.2 (from -r requirements.txt (line 1)) (from versions: 0.12.1, 1.0.0, 1.0.1, 1.1.0rc0, 1.1.0rc1, 1.1.0rc2, 1.1.0, 1.2.0rc0, 1.2.0rc1, 1.2.0rc2, 1.2.0, 1.2.1, 1.3.0rc0, 1.3.0rc1, 1.3.0rc2, 1.3.0, 1.4.0rc0, 1.4.0rc1, 1.4.0, 1.4.1, 1.5.0rc0, 1.5.0rc1, 1.5.0, 1.5.1, 1.6.0rc0, 1.6.0rc1, 1.6.0, 1.7.0rc0, 1.7.0rc1, 1.7.0, 1.7.1, 1.8.0rc0, 1.8.0rc1, 1.8.0, 1.9.0rc0, 1.9.0rc1, 1.9.0rc2, 1.9.0, 1.10.0rc0, 1.10.0rc1, 1.10.0, 1.10.1, 1.11.0rc0, 1.11.0rc1, 1.11.0rc2, 1.11.0, 1.12.0rc0, 1.12.0rc1, 1.12.0rc2, 1.12.0, 1.12.2, 1.12.3, 1.13.0rc0, 1.13.0rc1, 1.13.0rc2, 1.13.1, 1.13.2, 1.14.0rc0, 1.14.0rc1, 1.14.0, 2.0.0a0, 2.0.0b0, 2.0.0b1)
 No matching distribution found for tensorflow<2.0,>=1.15.2 (from -r requirements.txt (line 1))
 [root@E3-1585-3 model-optimizer]# python3 --version
 Python 3.6.8
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
 
 
 Install OpenVINO 2021.1 on Centos 7 docker image (https://hub.docker.com/_/centos)
 Install model-optimizer via:
 
 <denchmark-code>RUN cd openvino/model-optimizer
 pip3 install -r requirements.txt; 
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-h:h5>Issue submission checklist</denchmark-h>
 
 
 [Y] I report the issue, it's not a question
 
 
 [Y] I checked the problem with documentation, FAQ, open issues, Stack Overflow, etc and have not found solution
 
 
 [N] There is reproducer code and related data files: images, videos, models, etc.

comments_0.comment_text: Same error was seen on Ubuntu18.04

comments_1.comment_text:
I also ran into this issue before, I believe it was due to the Python pip3 version, which version are you using? Try upgrading to the latest.
 Regards,
 Jesus

comments_2.comment_text:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jgespino>@jgespino</denchmark-link>
  ,
 I am on below versions:
 pip 9.0.1 from /usr/lib/python3/dist-packages (python 3.6)
 python3 is already the newest version (3.6.7-1~18.04)
 I am on latest support on ubuntu18.04.
 Any comments?

comments_3.comment_text:
Alright I upgraded the pip3 using this 'pip3 install --upgrade pip'. Which sets pip3 to 20.2.4.
 Although the MO requirements get installed successfully, I see this in between somewhere:
 <denchmark-code>ERROR: After October 2020 you may experience errors when installing or updating packages. This is because pip will change the way that it resolves dependency conflicts.
 
 We recommend you use --use-feature=2020-resolver to test your packages with the new resolver before it becomes the default.
 
 tensorflow 1.15.4 requires numpy<1.19.0,>=1.16.0, but you'll have numpy 1.19.2 which is incompatible.
 </denchmark-code>
 
 Any impact should we foresee ?

comments_4.comment_text:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dpatel257>@dpatel257</denchmark-link>
 
 I am checking with the development team about the error message that is coming from TensorFlow 1.15.4, our requirement_tf.txt lists numpy >= 1.13.0. However, it appears TF 1.15.4 is incompatible with numpy 1.19.0 or newer.
 In the meantime, try to install numpy version 1.18.5, you can do:
 <denchmark-code>pip3 uninstall numpy
 pip3 install numpy==1.18.5
 </denchmark-code>
 
 Regards,
 Jesus
 Ref. 41996
